column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////I usually start off with their takoyaki
column2: which is awesome. It's so full of flavor and a decent portion for an appetizer. Careful though because it's really hot when you bite into it. I've also tried the crispy brussel sprouts
column3: which were also excellent. My go-to entree is probably the spicy chicken. The problem with a lot of ramen places I've tried is that the broth is way too salty
column4: but this place has got it down. The noodles are not too al dente or too soggy as well. Service is usually good here
column5: and the food has come out fairly quickly every time I've gone here for dinner.
